name: Circle of Protection: Black
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

name: Circle of Protection: Red
oracle_text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

flavor_text: Such power protects the body with the strength of the soul.

name: Honor Guard
oracle_text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

name: Infantry Veteran

rulings.text: An “attacking creature” is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

name: Inspirit

to the people of the Philippines

name: Leonin Skyhunter
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

name: Marble Titan

name: Master Decoy

flavor_text: A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.

—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

name: Oracle's Attendants
oracle_text: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
flavor_text: They follow the prophecy to each new prophet, guarding the future from the present.

oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor_text: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

name: Paladin en-Vec

name: Reverse Damage
oracle_text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
flavor_text:
"My enemy's hatred is his weakness. My enemy's anger is my strength."
—Remin, venerable monk

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

name: Righteousness
oracle_text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

rulings.text: A “blocking creature” is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

name: Sacred Ground
oracle_text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
flavor_text: The knight knelt and prayed, first for the sanctity of his land and second for the strength to repel its invaders.

name: Sacred Nectar
oracle_text: You gain 4 life.
flavor_text:
"Over the silver mountains,
Where spring the nectar fountains,
There will I kiss
The bowl of bliss;
And drink my everlasting fill. . . ."
—Sir Walter Raleigh, "The Pilgrimage"

name: Samite Healer
oracle_text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

name: Sanctum Guardian
oracle_text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Savannah Lions
flavor_text:

—Somali proverb

name: Seasoned Marshal
oracle_text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor_text:
"We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat."
—Queen Victoria

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

name: Serra Angel

flavor_text: When she flies above the good, they consider themselves blessed. When she flies above the wicked, they consider themselves dead.

name: Serra's Blessing

flavor_text: "Rise, and I will show you how to run without flagging, fight without raging, and fly without wings."

name: Skyhunter Prowler
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

name: Soul Warden
oracle_text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other’s ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

name: Spirit Link
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

name: Story Circle
oracle_text: As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Suntail Hawk
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

name: Tempest of Light
oracle_text: Destroy all enchantments.
flavor_text: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course."

name: Venerable Monk
oracle_text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor_text: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

name: Veteran Cavalier
oracle_text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor_text:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb

name: Warrior's Honor
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"No person was ever honored for what he received. Honor has been the reward for what he gave."
—Calvin Coolidge

rulings.text: Warrior’s Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won’t get the bonus.

name: Weathered Wayfarer
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Activate this ability only if an opponent controls more lands than you.

name: Worship
oracle_text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
flavor_text:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

name: Wrath of God
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

name: Zealous Inquisitor
oracle_text: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zealous Inquisitor this turn is dealt to target creature instead.
flavor_text: Wine and balm for the confessions of the repentant. Razors and irons for the confessions of the unrepentant.

name: Air Elemental
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Pray that it doesn't seek the safety of your lungs.

You control enchanted land.
flavor_text: You should see how small the map is.

name: Archivist

flavor_text:

name: Aven Fisher
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

flavor_text: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

name: Aven Windreader
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of their library.
flavor_text: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

name: Azure Drake
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

name: Baleful Stare
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
flavor_text: "Though there is little to be learned from your dust and stones, I shall wring them dry nevertheless."

name: Battle of Wits
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.
flavor_text: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.

rulings.text: Battle of Wits has an “intervening ‘if’ clause.” This means that if you don’t have 200 or more cards in your library at the beginning of your upkeep, the ability won’t trigger. If the ability does trigger, but you have fewer than 200 cards in your library when the ability resolves, the ability will do nothing.
In tournaments, you must be able to shuffle your entire deck within a reasonable amount of time.

name: Boomerang
oracle_text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser, The Faerie Queene

name: Clone
oracle_text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any “as [this creature] enters the battlefield” or “[this creature] enters the battlefield with” abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn’t copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can’t become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that’s already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone’s ability doesn’t target the chosen creature.

name: Confiscate
oracle_text: Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.

rulings.text: If you take control of an Aura, you do not get to move it.

name: Counsel of the Soratami
oracle_text: Draw two cards.
flavor_text: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."

name: Cowardice
oracle_text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

name: Crafty Pathmage
oracle_text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
flavor_text:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"

rulings.text: If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can’t be blocked that turn.

name: Daring Apprentice
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
flavor_text: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

name: Dehydration
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

name: Dream Prowler
oracle_text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.
flavor_text:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

name: Evacuation
oracle_text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor_text: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?

name: Exhaustion
oracle_text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.
flavor_text: Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player’s next untap step. They can still can untap during other player’s untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

name: Fishliver Oil
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

name: Fleeting Image
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow."
—Aesop, Fables, trans. Jacobs

name: Flight
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

name: Fugitive Wizard
flavor_text: The College of Lat-Nam is often forced to expel students whose experiments grow too risky or too cruel.

name: Horned Turtle
flavor_text: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

name: Imaginary Pet
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"

rulings.text: Imaginary Pet’s ability triggers only if you have cards in your hand as your upkeep begins, and the ability checks again as it resolves. If your hand is empty at both those times, Imaginary Pet stays on the battlefield.

name: Levitation
oracle_text: Creatures you control have flying.
flavor_text: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.

name: Lumengrid Warden
flavor_text: His peers derive knowledge from ancient tomes locked within dark spires. He finds knowledge within the solitude of a lifetime spent watching the Quicksilver Sea.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Mana Leak
oracle_text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
flavor_text: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

name: Mind Bend
oracle_text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can’t change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as “Island Fish Jasconius”.
It can be used to change a land’s type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn’t change the name of any permanent.

name: Phantom Warrior
oracle_text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
flavor_text:
"There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Illusions"

name: Plagiarize
oracle_text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
flavor_text: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

rulings.text: If you target yourself, this spell has no useful effect. It will not cause an infinite loop since a replacement effect can’t modify the same event more than once. This effect will not modify the draw that it has you perform.
You draw the card from your library as normal, not from your opponent’s library.

If you and your opponent each cast Plagiarize on each other during the same turn, the two spells effectively cancel each other out. You will draw cards when you normally would and so will your opponent.

If you target a player whose library is empty, any effect or turn-based action that would cause that player to draw a card will cause you to draw a card instead. It doesn’t matter that the other player would be unable to draw.

name: Polymorph
oracle_text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.

rulings.text: If there are no creatures in the player’s library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player’s library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. Nothing else happens.
If there are no creature cards in the player’s library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.
If the targeted creature has indestructible, it’s still a legal target — it just isn’t destroyed. The rest of Polymorph’s effect happens as normal.

name: Puppeteer
oracle_text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
flavor_text: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."

rulings.text: You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

name: Reminisce
oracle_text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
flavor_text: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

rulings.text: This card won’t be put into your graveyard until after it’s finished resolving, which means it won’t be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

name: Remove Soul
oracle_text: Counter target creature spell.
flavor_text: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

name: Rewind
oracle_text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
flavor_text: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."

rulings.text: Rewind targets only a spell. It doesn’t target any lands. The lands are chosen as Rewind resolves.
You can choose up to four lands, no matter who controls any of them. Those lands untap once. You can’t choose one land and have it untap four times, for example.

If the spell is an illegal target when Rewind tries to resolve, perhaps because it was countered by another spell or ability, Rewind won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won’t untap any lands.
If Rewind resolves but the target spell can’t be countered, you’ll still untap lands.

name: Sage Aven
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Sage Aven enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

name: Sea Monster
oracle_text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor_text: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

name: Sea's Claim
oracle_text: Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Enchanted land is an Island.
flavor_text:
"Who's the crazy one now!?"
—Torgle, mountaintop boatmaker

name: Sift
oracle_text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
flavor_text: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.

name: Sleight of Hand
oracle_text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
flavor_text:
"Gambling with mages never is."
—Remin, venerable monk

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, you put it into your hand.

name: Storm Crow
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

name: Telepathy
oracle_text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
flavor_text: "Secrets? What secrets?"

name: Temporal Adept
oracle_text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"If yesterday was two days ago tomorrow, will the day after tomorrow be today or yesterday?"
—Temporal Manipulation 101 final exam,
Tolarian Academy

name: Thieving Magpie
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
flavor_text: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

name: Thought Courier
oracle_text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor_text: "There's an assortment to satisfy all your needs: deep, fleeting, dirty, pure, scientific, philosophical, after, and even fore. For a price."

name: Tidal Kraken
oracle_text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.
flavor_text: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

name: Tidings
oracle_text: Draw four cards.
flavor_text:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Time Ebb
oracle_text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
flavor_text: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

name: Trade Routes
oracle_text: {1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
flavor_text: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.

name: Traumatize
oracle_text: Target player puts the top half of their library, rounded down, into their graveyard.
flavor_text: You won't know what you're missing.

rulings.text: The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

name: Treasure Trove
oracle_text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Wealth means power; the power to subdue, to crush, to exploit, the power to enslave, to outrage, to degrade."
—Emma Goldman, "Anarchism"

name: Wanderguard Sentry
oracle_text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
flavor_text: It allows those with dangerous weapons to pass. But not those with dangerous thoughts.

name: Wind Drake
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"

name: Withering Gaze
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.
flavor_text: "Nature cares not for the knowledge to be gained from its study. Better to bleed it dry, lest its potential be wasted on lizards and leaves."

name: Zur's Weirding
oracle_text: Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur’s Weirding’s replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur’s Weirding’s ability, then if you’re going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

name: Blackmail
oracle_text: Target player reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.
flavor_text: In addition to killing peasants, punishing subordinates, and raising an army of nightmares, Braids somehow found time for her favorite hobby: petty extortion.

rulings.text: If the player has less than 3 cards, all of them are revealed.

name: Bog Imp
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

name: Bog Wraith
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

name: Coercion
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor_text: "Of all I that I have lost, I miss my mind the most."

name: Consume Spirit
oracle_text: Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.
flavor_text:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

name: Contaminated Bond
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

name: Cruel Edict
oracle_text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text:
"No mockeries now for them; no prayers nor bells, / Nor any voice of mourning save the choirs,— / The shrill, demented choirs of wailing shells."
—Wilfred Owen,
"Anthem for Doomed Youth"

name: Dark Banishing
oracle_text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say ‘death,'
For exile hath more terror in his look,
Much more than death."
—William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

name: Death Pits of Rath
oracle_text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"

name: Deathgazer
oracle_text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor_text: Your entire life passes before its eyes.

name: Diabolic Tutor
oracle_text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

name: Drudge Skeletons
oracle_text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor_text:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

name: Enfeeblement
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
flavor_text:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek

name: Execute
oracle_text: Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

name: Fear
oracle_text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text:
"Don't fear the darkness. Fear what it hides."
—Remin, venerable monk

name: Festering Goblin
oracle_text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

name: Final Punishment
oracle_text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to that player this turn.
flavor_text: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

rulings.text: Damage that is prevented does not count toward the total.

name: Foul Imp
oracle_text: Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
flavor_text: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Giant Cockroach
flavor_text: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

name: Gluttonous Zombie
oracle_text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

name: Grave Pact
oracle_text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

name: Gravedigger
oracle_text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

name: Hell's Caretaker
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Hell’s Caretaker can be the creature sacrificed to activate its ability, but it can’t be the target of its own ability.

The upkeep step is before the draw step, after the untap step. Because the turn has already begun, creatures put onto the battlefield during your upkeep won’t be able to attack or pay a {T} cost this turn.

name: Highway Robber
oracle_text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
flavor_text: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."

name: Hollow Dogs
oracle_text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

name: Horror of Horrors
oracle_text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Hypnotic Specter
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

name: Looming Shade
oracle_text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

name: Lord of the Undead
oracle_text: Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"

rulings.text: Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

name: Megrim
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor_text:
"You can run from your pain, but you will tire before it does."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Mind Rot
oracle_text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor_text:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

name: Mindslicer
oracle_text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards their hand.
flavor_text: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.

name: Mortivore
oracle_text: Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

name: Nantuko Husk
oracle_text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Nantuko Husk itself to activate its own ability. However, the only thing that will do is put Nantuko Husk into the graveyard.

name: Nekrataal
oracle_text: First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

name: Nightmare
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor_text: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

name: Persecute
oracle_text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.
flavor_text:
"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind
The worst is that which persecutes the mind."
—John Dryden,
"The Hind and the Panther"

rulings.text: The color is chosen on resolution.

name: Phyrexian Arena
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor_text: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

name: Phyrexian Gargantua
oracle_text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
flavor_text: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

name: Plague Beetle
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Plague Wind
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant

name: Raise Dead
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

name: Ravenous Rats
oracle_text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
flavor_text: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.

name: Razortooth Rats
oracle_text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor_text:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Royal Assassin
oracle_text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor_text: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can’t target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin’s ability resolves, then the ability doesn’t resolve.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor_text:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Sengir Vampire
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
flavor_text: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

name: Serpent Warrior
oracle_text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor_text: They are incubated by swamp gases and cut their teeth on zombie flesh. Serpent warriors are not to be trifled with.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

name: Slay
oracle_text: Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

rulings.text: You don’t draw a card if this spell is countered.

name: Soul Feast
oracle_text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
flavor_text: You are who you eat.

name: Spineless Thug
oracle_text: Spineless Thug can't block.
flavor_text: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

name: Swarm of Rats
oracle_text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
flavor_text:
"Rats, rats, rats! Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, Dracula

name: Underworld Dreams
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor_text:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

name: Unholy Strength
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
flavor_text: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.

name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Yawgmoth Demon
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

rulings.text: The sacrificing of an artifact is not mandatory. You can choose not to sacrifice an artifact but will pay the consequences.

name: Zombify
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor_text:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder

name: Anaba Shaman
oracle_text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Just try taking this bull by the horns.

name: Anarchist
oracle_text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.

name: Balduvian Barbarians
flavor_text:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

name: Blaze
oracle_text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
flavor_text: Fire never dies alone.

name: Blood Moon
oracle_text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
flavor_text: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

rulings.text: If a nonbasic land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, it will lose that ability before it applies. The same is also true of any other abilities that modify how a land enters the battlefield or apply “as” a land enters the battlefield, such as the first ability of Cavern of Souls. This is a change from previous rulings.
Nonbasic lands will lose any other land types and abilities they had. They will gain the land type Mountain and gain the ability “{T}: Add {R}.”
This effect doesn’t affect names or supertypes. It won’t turn any land into a basic land or remove the legendary supertype from a legendary land, and the lands won’t be named “Mountain.”
If a nonbasic land has an ability that triggers “when” it enters the battlefield, it will lose that ability before it triggers.

name: Bloodfire Colossus
oracle_text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: It deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor_text: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.

name: Boiling Seas
oracle_text: Destroy all Islands.
flavor_text: What burns the land, boils the seas.

name: Demolish
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or land.
flavor_text:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

name: Enrage
oracle_text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."

name: Firebreathing
oracle_text: Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing’s controller, not the enchanted creature’s controller (in case they’re different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

name: Flame Wave
oracle_text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
flavor_text:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Flashfires
oracle_text: Destroy all Plains.
flavor_text: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

name: Flowstone Crusher
oracle_text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"What's better than smashing things with a rock? A rock that gets up and smashes things for you."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

rulings.text: Flowstone Crusher’s ability can be activated multiple times, but Flowstone Crusher is put into the graveyard after an effect resolves that makes its toughness 0.

name: Flowstone Shambler
oracle_text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

name: Flowstone Slide
oracle_text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
flavor_text: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.

name: Form of the Dragon
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Form of the Dragon deals 5 damage to any target.
At the beginning of each end step, your life total becomes 5.
Creatures without flying can't attack you.

rulings.text: If you life total was above 5 at end of turn, then you lose life to make your total 5. If it was less than 5, you gain life to bring it to 5.
It sets your life total at the beginning of the end step of every player’s turn, not just your own.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can’t attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

name: Furnace of Rath
oracle_text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
flavor_text: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can’t normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, “Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.” Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting themselves. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
oracle_text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
flavor_text: They patched the holes, loaded their sharpest rocks, spanked their children one last time, and lurched off into the sunset.

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade’s ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won’t change that.

name: Goblin Brigand
oracle_text: Goblin Brigand attacks each combat if able.
flavor_text: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.

name: Goblin Chariot
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

name: Goblin King
oracle_text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor_text: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

name: Goblin Mountaineer
oracle_text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor_text: The only thing worse than a goblin is a goblin that knows his way around.

name: Goblin Piker
flavor_text: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

name: Goblin Sky Raider
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

name: Guerrilla Tactics
oracle_text: Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to any target.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

name: Hill Giant
flavor_text: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

name: Karplusan Yeti
oracle_text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

rulings.text: Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.

If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability won’t resolve and no damage will be dealt.

name: Kird Ape
oracle_text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
flavor_text: It puts the "fur" in "fury."

name: Lava Axe
oracle_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor_text: "Catch!"

name: Lightning Elemental
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

name: Magnivore
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

name: Mana Clash
oracle_text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of their opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card’s coin flip has no winner or loser.

name: Mogg Sentry
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Nothing makes a mogg madder than having to wake up.

name: Ogre Taskmaster

name: Beast of Burden
oracle_text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.

name: Booby Trap
oracle_text: As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, choose an opponent and a card name other than a basic land card name.
The chosen player reveals each card they draw.
When the chosen player draws a card with the chosen name, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

rulings.text: The “if you do” part is only done if you successfully sacrifice this card. In other words, it has to be on the battlefield when the trigger resolves or it does not deal damage.
The choice of which card to name is part of the resolution of the spell or ability which puts Booby Trap onto the battlefield. It can’t be countered.
If an effect causes the player to draw multiple cards, each card is revealed as it’s drawn. If Booby Trap’s ability triggers, it will go on the stack once the card-drawing effect has concluded.
If a single Booby Trap’s ability triggers multiple times, then only the first ability to resolve causes Booby Trap to be sacrificed and damage to be dealt.
If Booby Trap’s last ability is countered, Booby Trap remains on the battlefield (and no damage is dealt).

name: Bottle Gnomes

name: Coat of Arms
oracle_text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
flavor_text:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn’t give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

name: Dancing Scimitar

name: Defense Grid

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don’t cost extra on your own turn.

name: Demon's Horn

flavor_text: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
If a player casts a black spell, Demon’s Horn’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon’s Horn’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

name: Disrupting Scepter

flavor_text: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."

name: Dragon's Claw
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
flavor_text: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
If a player casts a red spell, Dragon’s Claw’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon’s Claw’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

name: Fellwar Stone
oracle_text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
flavor_text:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, the Pretender

rulings.text: It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
This works even if the opponent’s lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.
The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can’t be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.

Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn’t check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability “{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color.” If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn’t matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn’t matter whether it’s untapped.

When determining what colors of mana your opponents’ lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands’ mana abilities (such as Contamination’s effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Fellwar Stone doesn’t care about any restrictions or riders your opponents’ lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

name: Howling Mine
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
flavor_text: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

name: Icy Manipulator
oracle_text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor_text: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.

rulings.text: Once a player announces that they’re casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, other players can’t try to tap that player’s permanents to stop them from paying {T} or to stop them from producing enough mana.

name: Jade Statue
oracle_text: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Activate this ability only during combat.
flavor_text:
"The paradox of jade statues is that their victims never really expect attack, but they are never completely surprised either."
—Kabel, Tolarian archivist

rulings.text: It can only make itself into a creature during combat phases and therefore it is difficult to get Auras placed on it.

A delayed triggered ability that refers to Jade Statue still affects it even if it’s no longer a creature. For example, if Jade Statue blocks the Kashi-Tribe Warriors (“Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn’t untap during its controller’s next untap step.”), the Warriors’ effect stops Jade Statue from untapping.
If Jade Statue’s ability has been activated, abilities that trigger “at end of combat” will see Jade Statue as an artifact creature.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Jade Statue is animated by some other effect, you get an artifact creature with whatever power, toughness, and creature types (if any) are specified by that effect. If you subsequently use Jade Statue’s ability during combat, it will become 3/6 and gain the creature type Golem in addition to those creature types until end of combat.

name: Jester's Cap

flavor_text:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

rulings.text: If the player has less than 3 cards in their library, just exile all the cards that are there.

name: Kraken's Eye
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
flavor_text: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken’s Eye’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken’s Eye’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

name: Millstone
oracle_text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
flavor_text: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

name: Spellbook
oracle_text: You have no maximum hand size.
flavor_text:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you’ll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

name: Storage Matrix
oracle_text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during their untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

rulings.text: This card’s ability does not override effects which prevent a permanent from untapping.
Permanents with multiple types untap if any of their types is chosen. For example, an artifact creature untaps if either artifact or creature is chosen.

If another effect limits the number of permanents that untap, that number combines with Storage Matrix’s effect. For example, Imi Statue says “players can’t untap more than one artifact during their untap steps.” If both Imi Statue and an untapped Storage Matrix are on the battlefield, and you choose “artifact,” only one artifact untaps.
